Reviews.Title: “Overall a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Xelaboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Isabel for two nights in Feb 12, to be honest I wasn't sure what to expect since the reviews varied widely. I found the hotel to be ok, I had no problems. The positives : Great location (less than 10min walk from the Zocalo), great price (EUR15), large room with balcony & 18' ceilings, room was quiet despite overlooking the street, hot shower that worked, room was very clean, bed was of an unusual size,somewhere between a single & a double,fine for 1 person,tight for two but it was comfortable (it did have a hard mattress but I like that). I dealt with two different young ladies at reception & found both to be pleasant & helpful. The negatives : there was a strong smell from the pipes in the bathroom, not sewage as a previous contributor mentioned, moreso I'd say just a really old piping system showing its age. The problem was solved by closing the bathroom door. The safe in my room was closed on my arrival & this problem was not solved during my stay. I booked the room via email directly with the hotel. However when I arrived I got the impression that they had no record of my booking, but because there were rooms available this was not a problem. I would like to reiterate this is just an impession I got, not a fact. They do have free WiFi but the sevice was intermittent. Overall I was very pleased with my stay, & would stay here again if in Mexico City.Bottom line, for EUR15 per night you get a clean bed & a shower & what more does one expect for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Everyone's Cup of Tea”
Reviews.Author: Grousedoctor
Reviews.Content: I'm in Mexico City twice a year and I always stay at the Isabel! As you can see from the reviews of Tripadvisor, it's not everyone's cup of tea. On the positive side, the hotel is located less than a ten minute walk to the Zocalo. I've always found the neighborhood safe and friendly. The old colonial-style building has a certain charm although a whole lot of TLC would greatly improve its time-worn appearance. Unlike some, I've always found the front desk staff friendly. The cleaning ladies have always been pleasant, leave my room is great shape, and enjoy speaking Spanish with those of us just learning the language. Finally, it's a really cheap sleep if you're on a tight budget or you just don't like spending more for a hotel in Mexico. Now, the negative! As charming as the hotel is, it is in need of some updating. Internet is available in the lobby for a fee; no WiFi. Be sure and ask for a room with a balcony. Many of these are very large, with high ceilings although a bit delapidated. Avenida Isabel is a busy street. Therefore, it does tend to be a little noisy, but that's true of most of central DF. I tend to enjoy having the windows open inspite of the car and truck noise. Unfortunately, we had bed bugs on our last stay. However, in all the times I've stayed there, this was the first time I had to complain about such a condition in my room. Sure, paint and updating could brighten the rooms, but I also enjoy the atmosphere of a place that takes me back in time to an era in Mexico City I didn't experience. My wife is picky about where we stay when we travel in Mexico and Cental America, but she is fine with the Hotel Isabel in spite of it failings. Location and price are two big pluses. I already have my spring reservation at the Isabel and look forward to my week long visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided.”
Reviews.Author: Adamcaw
Reviews.Content: The benefits of staying here are the location, large rooms, and cable TV. The water system has been sporadic over the last 2 nights. Currently the hot water tap gurgles and produces a brown liquid. The hot water doesn't work anyway. There have been frequent blackouts, and the hotel's generator only covers the lobby and restaurant. Wifi works in the rooms but cuts out every 15 minutes. The staff are unhelpful. We asked if we could use a laundry and were directed somewhere that didn't exist, or was closed for Christmas (they were initially unsure whether it was 2 or 3 streets away). Later we asked if we could use any sort of facilities at the hotel, even a large sink we found, and were told to wait until the non-existent laundry opens. Overall, you'd be better off staying somewhere else. Even somewhere cheaper than 420 pesos would probably be better.

Reviews.Title: “Old style on a tight budget, wifi, room service, safe”
Reviews.Author: sirenanathalieNyc
Reviews.Content: The antique style tall ceiling rooms and l covered courtyard make this place have charm while in the center of downtown. Good value, about $22 a night for one. Safe for a woman traveling solo. Has emenities like Wi Fi (a bit slow), Room service, room safe, tv, a homey cafe and bar. Seems to be popular with European tourist. The rooms have very old time high ceiling, vintage hotel furnishings, showers. Not beautiful but basic. A little run down but for the price and location who cares. I like the balcony rooms with the old fashion glass doors. The staff is not overly friendly but very professional. Nice Day of the Dead altar in the lobby one visit.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude staff, creepy rooms, hated it”
Reviews.Author: DanielJop172
Reviews.Content: One of my worst experiences, really rude front desk staff, a nightmare sleep, leaky bathrooms were enough to run away from there first nite.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to the Centro”
Reviews.Author: Coolabah99
Reviews.Content: Clean & quiet and an easy walk to the historical parts of the city. No breakfast included but a good restaurant attached and a fun little bar to meet the locals and try the tequila!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and central location”
Reviews.Author: Gen177
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just blocks away from the Centro Historico in Mexico City making it an ideal place to stay. The Hotel has a beautiful internal courtyard too. With breakfast included the price was good for the one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Btravel011
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very helpfull and clean, the location is great and there is a nice roof terrace were you can hangout in the sun. When we returned on the way back to mexico city we could leave our backpacks here for free in the luggage room during the day, which was very nice. You can pick a room with or with shared bedroom so for every one's budet there is something.Downstairs is a restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner which is nice and close.. There is free wifi also.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasant place”
Reviews.Author: Kikagy
Reviews.Content: Its an old hotel but our stayment was very pleasant, the staff was good, the internet is fast, and if you eat at the restaurant its cheapest and very great, at the bar you can drink tequila mmmm....

Reviews.Title: “the second time was better Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡”
Reviews.Author: maicolOurense
Reviews.Content: Very well Â¡Â¡Â¡Â¡ Is the second time that I was hosted at the hotel Isabel and the truth I am happy, They have improved enough, find better service, Wi-Fi in the rooms, very spacious rooms, very friendly staff, very nice outside building because you arrangement recently, have improved! The restaurant and bar with more varieties news and very good prices If you travel to the city of MÃ©xico hotel Isabel is very good option

Reviews.Title: “Hotel isabel is not a good value, it is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: judymc1
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travel on a low price budget. Granted, we are now middle-aged and accommodations that suited us in our youth do not always appeal to us. Hotel Isabel is definitely inexpensive but it is also dark, dreary,and dingy with an unhelpful staff. Our reservation was not available even though I had confirmed it twice. There was no apology or explanation. They put us in a very small room on the top floor, with a shared bathroom and a view of the corrugated roof covering. We often use this type of room but the bathroom at Hotel Isabel was not clean. The bar and restaurant reeked of desperateness. The safe and remote control did not work. We left the next day and found a hotel down the street (even closer to the Zocalo) for $20 more. If money is your prime consideration this hotel is fine but if you can spend a bit more there are lots of better places.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Mexico City's historic centre”
Reviews.Author: LonewolfNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Within easy walking distance of all the sights in the historic centre and well-connected to the rest of the city, Hotel Isabel is a great bargain. Thin sheets, hard mattress and lumpy pillows, but huge, very clean rooms around bright courtyards with plenty of character. Helpful staff - room service is not on offer, but a disabled guest in the room next door had no difficulty arranging this. Good restaurant downstairs with friendly serrvice and plenty of breakfast options as well as lunch and dinner; internet access (not sure if it was free); a very helpful travel desk for arranging tours and onward tickets; good security. All this for about Â£12 per night. Hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: alm711
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation online and received a confimation very quickly. I told them we would be arriving at 10 am, and asked if we could leave our luggage there if the room was not ready. They said this would be fine, but it turned out that the room was ready and we were able to relax a bit before heading out for a day's sightseeing. The location is great: just a few blocks from the zocalo. Our room, 207, was huge, with very high ceilings. I did notice the holes in each corner of the ceiling, and assumed these were for ventilation. There was a balcony overlooking the street, but it was quiet after about 10:00 pm, except when peoplewere coming in to the room next door in the middle of the night. The room, including the bathroom, was quite clean, though the floor was stained and the lighting was bad. There was plenty of hot water immediately when you turned on the faucet. There were three of us, the room had three beds (to me they were wonderfully firm, which I like) and we paid $490 pesos for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Happy times”
Reviews.Author: yippeiokiyay
Reviews.Content: I wonder if there is any alternative to Hotel Isabel in location and price? I have been looking, but haven't yet seen anything comparable for my upcoming trip to Mexico City. The restaurant, the bar, the lobby and colonial architecture, friendly staff, and amazing rooftop views made Hotel Isabel a worthwhile stay...add to that the rock-bottom value, proximity to the Zocalo (it's a skip away) and the metro- and it would be very hard to convince me that anything else is as good a value. Rooms a bit dim? Sure. Beds a wee bit on the firm side? uhuh. Are these problems? If these are problems, stay home. I found the people lovely and am happy to recommend the Hotel Isabel to budget travelers. I stayed here on my own, with a student group and with a good friend-each experience excellent, and the restaurant staff began to greet me with coffee just the way I liked it-hey, there is nothing better!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but great value for money”
Reviews.Author: KateB2
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Mexico City. In walking distance of most major central sites and close to the metro for travelling further afield. Room was a bit dingy and shabby and bathroom poorly ventilated with a lot of ominous black mold but for $30/night who's complaining (and it's a beautiful building with a lot of character). Staff were friendly and helpful re calling taxis etc but it did take 48 hours and constant pestering for someone to come to open the safety deposit box for us only to find out it was broken so that was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “great place, good price and ubication”
Reviews.Author: maicolOurense
Reviews.Content: i was in the isabel hotel last week, the staff are very friendly and helpful. i make a reservation by internet and i received an answer very quickly and friendly. when i arrive my reservation was ok., the price is good. is confourtable because you have a restaurant and bar in the same building, the food is very good, i was in the bar too and the experience was wonderfull because i drank mezcal and tequila. so if you want a good place in downtawn mexico city, good price, good location, friendly staff, security, isabel hotel is the better option.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right, the location is great, some small irritants”
Reviews.Author: Grizinator
Reviews.Content: I checked in here twice on my recent Mexico trip (start and end of the trip) staying a total of 5 nights. I first had room 112 and when I retruned I got room 115. Both were interior rooms, plain decor with old but sturdy furniture. I didn't care, as someone else said, "I was only there to sleep and shower". I was originally given room 108, an exterior room with a Juliet balcony, but the room wasn't made when I arrived and I wanted to shower and nap, so I changed to 112 (which was already prepared). If you get an exterior room, steet noise may be a problem during the day, but in the evening (past 10 PM) the area is quiet. When I was in room 112 (towards the back of the building) noise was not a problem, but when i was in room 115, along the north-wall, which is shared with the hostel next door, I heard noise late into the evening (read: Metallica, the Pulp Fiction soundtrack and ACDC...all music I like, just not when I'm trying to sleep) coming from the hostel. Other have mentioned the firmness of the mattresses...firm isn't the proper term...hard like a rock would be more adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful in getting me a cab to the airport at 4 AM, notifying me when my bags arrived (due to the airline losing them) and I got along great with the security guards and waitstaff at the resturant. The maid service was a little slow and it is true you may have to wait some time (or ask twice) for certain things, but all truth be told, if you don't sweat the little things and be patient, you'll get what you want in the end. Oh yeah, and that previous posting, where someone mentioned holes in the ceiling, room 112 had two in the bathroom. I zoomed in with my digital camera and took a picture. Nothing was up there and having seen them in other rooms, I think it was for helping the air circulate in the interior rooms. No bad stories about things being stolen and I felt very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyDestiny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to the zocalo and all the sights in central Mexico City and also close to the underground. The hotel has 24 hour security, and one of the guards, Alberto, was very friendly and helpful. My room was huge, but lacked a window. It didn't bother me, because I was only there to sleep and shower. The room was very clean, as was the hotel. There's a restaurant on the ground floor, too.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, but an architectural gem”
Reviews.Author: NowVoyageuse
Reviews.Content: Someone else's review mentions being put into a large room with 3 beds that he didn't want, and later his valuables were stolen from the safe in the room. That's interesting, because my boyfriend and I were also given a large room with 3 beds that we did not want. We were later pressured to pay for the larger room, which we refused to do. The staff was very rude about it all, and made a big show of forcing the young man who assigned us the room to pay the difference because we wouldn't. The building is a historic gem, however. And there's a cool bar on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Large and clean rooms but...”
Reviews.Author: mgiraudo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good for budget travelers. The people at the front desk are very friendly but not efficient: You ask for something and it could take several days to get it (like extra pillows, and the key for the safety deposit). I appreciated the room service from the restaurant, which was better than your touristic eating place and with very affordable prices ($3 to $10 dollar meals). The location is wonderful, only five blocks from the Zocalo and four from the nearest subway station. However, if yolu want to buy food or other stuff during a holiday or weekend, the place is shut down because it's the neighborhood for large whole sale. The interior of the hotel is beautiful, with an internal balcony painted in bright terracota colors. The rooms are clean and the hotel overall is kept very neatly. However, I would have given this hotel a higher rating if it wasn't for the mattresses. They are as hard as sleeping on a large piece of wood. We couldn't belive how bad they were and that was the only thing that made our stay less pleasant. I am trying to post this so if you have a back problem or cannot take hard mattresses, do not stay here. Otherwise it's great. The price I paid for four people in one room was $55 dollars with private bathroom. You can pay $18 for a double with shared bathroom or $30 for a double with bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a mexican i enjoyed for several years staying at this place because of the convenience of the vicinity to downtown. On 5-feb-06 i booked a room wich i thought was going to be nice. The front desk gave me a room for myself with 3 beds on the roof. The door knob would not close properly so feeling insecure i called the front desk asking for another room, they hesitated for a few minutes and came up with the idea that i should take a room on the second floor (room 205) i accepted. Again when i came into the room i was again surprised that only myself would get again a room with 3 beds. As i was tired from my flight to mex city i checked the safe-box on the wall and as i was convinced that it worked properly i put my money inside of it.while i was lying in bed i realized that the ceiling were very high and that in each of the corners of the room there was a dark hole about 4 in diameter, i joked with myself and thought maybe theyre cameras spying on me. Next day i went out all day and did not check on my money. On feb 7th as i was going out for breakfast i decided to check my money, i got nervous when i realized that my money was not complete. I called the front desk and they sent me a person that said to be the hotel manager i explained my case and he denied it saying that he was the only one to have access to the master key as i was already getting nowhere with him i inmediatly packed my luggage and left. I was robbed in this hotel. Please trip advisor do take this review into consideration. Why was i given a room with a high ceiling and 3 beds? I know my money is lost and i am not planning a lawsuit because of the waste of time but i still want you to warn others of want happened to me in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've travelled to several countries in Latin America and stayed at a good number of cheap hotels, but this one is the worst of all! They want your money and they don't care one bit about your satisfaction. I've reserved a room there one week prior to my stay. The front desk agent promised me a beautiful clean room with a great view, but once I've paid, he put me in a hole with no windows, cracking floor and a bed as hard as a rock. Stay elsewhere, it's not worth the trouble to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling and trying to keep your costs down, but still, at the same time you want good accomodation i would recommend Hotel Isabel (Mexico City). The Hotel is exceptionaly clean, friendly staff at the reception desk. And lets not forget the location, 5 minutes walk and you're at the main square. I was very impressed by the fact that i booked our room 6 weeks before through the internet and till our arriving i got confirmation emails weekly to ensure me that the room is booked for us. I really can't think about anything i'd complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Orange, Blue and kitschii - GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: bookie
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Isabel, from the moment we stepped into its lobby we felt welcome and excited. The walls are painted a shimmeringly colourful orange, while the pillars are contrastingly blue. The four main staff are young and extremely cool and friendly. The beds in the three different rooms we stayed in were comfortable, the rooms clean and very atmospheric. Bathrooms were also clean and bright with strong hot showers. Hotel Isabel's own restaurant downstairs does a smashingly good Chilaquiles for breakfast, with a glass of OJ, cup of te/cafe, and fresh bread with butter and jam for about 55pesos ($US5.5). Highly highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A whole lot of character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Isabel for 7 nights in May of 2003. The staff was very friendly and would do their best to accomodate myself and the 15 other university students I went with. During the week people from many different countries checked-in, which made for a great cultural experience. The hotel itself is old, but not without character. If I ever return to Mexico City I would like to stay in Hotel Isabel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Isabel a good value”
Reviews.Author: RudyAuk
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough for this very good and reasonably priced hotel. Very close to downtown, I think it's the best value. It has a good staff too. Rudy Aukschun

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Lady in the Centro Historico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at Hotel Isabel in January 2003. The place is a little shabby, in a good way. The rooms are huge and the staff is friendly. The price is down-right cheap, 180 pesos(about $16.50) for a single with bath. The rooms have TV, phone, and safe. There is hot water 24/7. The street noise level can be high. Beware! There is a disco next door that really cranks up the volume on Friday and Saturday nights.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Isabel
HotelInfo.Address: Isabel la Catolica 63, Mexico City 06000, Mexico
